node.title: Mark McGowan considers moving family from home in Perth's south amid alleged threats
node.alt: A close-up photo of WA Premier Mark McGowan.
node.description: WA Premier Mark McGowan is considering temporarily moving his family out of their Rockingham home after threats were allegedly made against him and his wife and children.
node.content:
["WA Premier Mark McGowan is considering temporarily moving his family out of their home after threats were allegedly made against him and his wife and children.", "Police have charged two men with making threatening phone calls to Mr McGowan.", "It is alleged a 20-year-old and an 18-year-old phoned the Premier on Saturday night and left several threatening messages.", "Mr McGowan said these were the worst alleged threats he had received so far.", "\"In terms of my own family, obviously it's not pleasant, it's not very nice and I just urge the people doing it to stop,\" he told reporters.", "He\u00a0said he had no immediate plans to move out of his Rockingham home, but added it was something \"we're considering\".", "
WA's jab plans won't change: Premier
", "Mr McGowan's electorate office in Rockingham closed last week after threats were allegedly made against his staff by people opposed to mandatory COVID-19 vaccines.", "He urged people to stop this type of\u00a0conduct.", "\"This is disturbing conduct, it's un-Australian conduct,\" he said.", "\"It's not going to change our approach. We're going to continue to work to get West Australians vaccinated. We're going to continue with the rules we've put in place, because that is what is needed.\"", "Mr McGowan has been targeted by anti-vaccination protesters outside government offices in Perth and while attending events, including in Bunbury on Sunday.", "But the Premier predicted the tensions would ease when the state reached the 90 per cent vaccination rate in late January or early February.", "", "
Going overseas? Here's what you need to know
", "\"As we get people vaccinated, I expect by February a lot of this heat and anger will be gone,\" he said.", "\"I just urge them to listen to the medical advice, stop all this silliness, get vaccinated.\"", "The two men charged with making the threats were granted bail and are due to face court next month."]
